001/*

005
006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.qname;
007
008import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.util.ObjectUtils;
009
010import java.net.URI;
011import java.util.Map;
012import java.util.Optional;
013import java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap;
014import java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicInteger;
015
016import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
017import nl.talsmasoftware.lazy4j.Lazy;
018
019/**
020 * An integer-based cache of namespaces to reduce the memory footprint of
021 * namespaces used by reusing instances with the same namespace.
022 */
023public final class NamespaceCache {
024  @NonNull
025  private static final Lazy<NamespaceCache> INSTANCE = ObjectUtils.notNull(Lazy.lazy(NamespaceCache::new));
026
027  private final Map<String, Integer> nsToIndex = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
028  private final Map<Integer, String> indexToNs = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
029  private final Map<Integer, URI> indexToNsUri = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
030  /**
031   * The next available namespace index position.
032   * <p>
033   * This value starts at 1, since the "" no namspace has the zero position.
034   */
035  private final AtomicInteger indexCounter = new AtomicInteger();
036
037  /**
038   * Get the singleton instance.
039   *
040   * @return the singleton instance
041   */
042  @NonNull
043  public static NamespaceCache instance() {
044    return ObjectUtils.notNull(INSTANCE.get());
045  }
046
047  private NamespaceCache() {
048    // claim the "0" position
049    int noNamespaceIndex = indexOf("");
050    assert noNamespaceIndex == 0;
051  }
052
053  /**
054   * Get the index value of the provided namespace.
055   *
056   * @param namespace
057   *          the namespace
058   * @return the index value
059   */
060  @SuppressWarnings("PMD.ShortMethodName")
061  public int indexOf(@NonNull String namespace) {
062    return nsToIndex.computeIfAbsent(namespace, key -> {
063      int nextIndex = indexCounter.getAndIncrement();
064      indexToNs.put(nextIndex, namespace);
065      return nextIndex;
066    });
067  }
068
069  /**
070   * Lookup the index value for an existing namespace.
071   *
072   * @param namespace
073   *          the namespace to lookup
074   * @return an optional containing the index value, if it exists
075   */
076  @NonNull
077  public Optional<Integer> get(@NonNull String namespace) {
078    return ObjectUtils.notNull(Optional.ofNullable(nsToIndex.get(namespace)));
079  }
080
081  /**
082   * Lookup the namespace using the index value for an existing namespace.
083   *
084   * @param index
085   *          the index value to lookup
086   * @return an optional containing the namespace, if the index value exists
087   */
088  @NonNull
089  public Optional<String> get(int index) {
090    return ObjectUtils.notNull(Optional.ofNullable(indexToNs.get(index)));
091  }
092
093  /**
094   * Lookup the namespace using the index value for an existing namespace.
095   *
096   * @param index
097   *          the index value to lookup
098   * @return an optional containing the namespace as a URI, if the index value
099   *         exists
100   */
101  @NonNull
102  public Optional<URI> getAsURI(int index) {
103    return ObjectUtils.notNull(Optional.ofNullable(indexToNsUri.computeIfAbsent(index, key -> {
104      Optional<String> namespace = get(key);
105      URI nsUri = null;
106      if (namespace.isPresent()) {
107        nsUri = URI.create(namespace.get());
108        indexToNsUri.put(key, nsUri);
109      }
110      return nsUri;
111    })));
112  }
113}
